Great! works now. I had tried that but with the wrong syntax (-b=...)

Thank you

My next problem is that I'm supposed to find something at http://67.207.136.21:8080/admin/
but that gives a 404 (try it!)

There must still be something wrong... Any idea?


----- Original Message ----
From: Erik Hetzner <erik.hetzner@...>
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Cc: bernardsirius <bernardsirius@...>
Sent: Thursday, April 10, 2008 2:30:24 AM
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] can't connect to the webui

At Wed, 09 Apr 2008 18:59:10 -0000,
"bernardsirius" <bernardsirius@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I'm trying to get the server started (using ubuntu server) and access
> it's web interface. Launching worked apparently (messages end with
> "Web UI listening on localhost:8080), but I can't connect to it from
> the outside (should be http://67.207.136.21:8080/admin/).
>
> What did I do wrong?

The web UI is listening on the localhost (127.0.0.1), not the external
interface (in your case, 67.207.136.21). You need to use the -b (bind)
option to bind to the 67.207.136.21 interface.

best,
Erik Hetzner
;; Erik Hetzner, California Digital Library
;; gnupg key id: 1024D/01DB07E3
